New Color Available! Delicate and classy, Blush Pink will definitely compliment your outfit :)


Fulfillment is provided by our capable and multi-talented partners at Fulfillrite. Our Fulfillrite friends are fast and they do things right the first time.
 Partners: 
Partners


This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarter launches with 1,400+ successful Kickstarter projects and over $500M raised in total.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have meticulously calculated all the possible scenarios we could think to encounter, but there are still things that one can’t anticipate. 

Port Closures and Delays: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, delays and problems might hinder the arrival date of your Keepods. We work with the best fulfillment companies and operate under a strict policy of total transparency to ensure that you are up-to-date on potential shipping complications. Check this Kickstarter page and social media platforms for updates. 

Volume: We have created a handful of manufacturing scenarios pending levels of demand, but with an unknown number of backers, there are always risks involved. If we reach our funding goal of $8,000, we will manufacture and deliver all Keepods ordered. 

Through designing, developing, prototyping, and testing our product, we’ve put a ton of time into this project. After undergoing such a long road, we’re extremely excited to be in our last step before production. We are certain you’ll enjoy all the value that Keepods can deliver- thanks for backing us! 

Stay tuned through social media.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
XChange is a brand new, hot-swappable tool changing solution for virtually any 3D printer. It enables all types of users, from professionals to those brand new to the world of 3D printing, to quickly and easily change tools with almost no down time. XChange is patent pending, designed and manufactured in the USA by PrinterMods.com.
Connect new tools in a single motion.
We designed XChange to be broadly compatible with most popular 3D printers, printer tools and accessories, while maintaining the smallest, lightest footprint possible.
Direct drive tool being removed
Made by us in the USA, XChange features an anodized aluminum frame, aerospace-grade electrical connectors, and is readily compatible with most existing 3D printers.
TeachingTech Review - 12-18-20
XChange incorporates an elegant mechanical and electrical connection that enables rapid tool changes using only a single motion. It is comprised of a master mounting assembly featuring a robust magnetic locking mechanism, and one or more interchangeable tool plates for fast swaps between multiple types of tools. 

Magnetic lock mechanism actuation
It works by pairing a master assembly, which remains affixed to your machine, with multiple interchangeable tool plates, using a strong magnetic coupling mechanism.
High quality electrical connectors connect the master assembly to your 3D printer's mother board, while each tool assembly has its own PCB with convenient wire-to-board connectors to connect your hot end, fans, extruders, and more.
Drawing of XChange assembly disengaged.

Whether you want to try out new tools or accessories, experiment with multi-material prints, make use of spare parts, or just maximize uptime for your printers, XChange makes it possible. Compatible with virtually any combination of tools and accessories you can imagine, XChange opens up a world of new possibilities, with the printer you already have.

It's great for:
Dedicated tool types for certain materials
Changing colors between or during prints
Fast maintenance - swapping a tool into service eliminates down time
Experimenting with new tools and accessories, like laser engravers, pen plotters, and more.
Teaching Tech's printed tool assembly cradle, 12-18-20
XChange was designed to be compatible with the most popular styles of 3D printers. It's natively compatible with any 3D printer using MGN12H linear rail on the X axis, and 2020 extrusion-based systems like Creality 3D printers using an optional V-slot rail adapter plate.

Works with factory 8-bit and 32-bit motherboards.
Natively compatible with MGN12H linear rail systems.
Compatible with V-slot wheels and 2020 extrusion using V-slot add-on.
Planned compatibility with Prusa i3 style machines (will require a printed adapter).
Compatible with popular ABL using up to 5-wire probes (such as BL Touch).
XChange is currently intended only for 24V 3D printers.
Capable of printing high temperature filaments in enclosures.
 Marlin 2.0.X Bugfix compatible - more firmware compatibility coming soon.
Other motion geometries can be supported with printed adapters, which are expected to be designed and released in early Q2 2021 (sooner if the community would like to contribute to this end).

Auto Bed Leveling
ABL probes like BL Touch, and capacitive and IR sensors will be supported natively by XChange, with a few different configuration options possible to suit a multitude of use cases. 
BL Touch probe being used on XChange with new ABL-capable boards

With XChange V1.0, ABL is supported on most 8-bit boards, and all 32-bit boards. 8-bit boards running Marlin 2.0.X currently support BL Touch, with our suite of tool changing features enabled. However, these boards are quite limited on available memory, and tool changing / BL Touch does fit, but doesn't leave much room for other features. We're working with skilled firmware developers to further reduce our needed footprint, and will be releasing firmware revisions to all backers for various popular machines.

Exploded view of master and tool assemblies


Electrical:
Robust, custom PCBs feature extra-thick traces, corrosion and wear resistant plating, and properly rated connectors from genuine parts suppliers like Samtec, TE Connectivity, Amphenol, On Shore, and others.
All PrinterMods products are manufactured to be RoHS-compliant.

Mechanical:
50N magnetic coupling mechanism, perfectly aligned to maintain a strong connection during prints, but releases at the push of a lever
Injection molded locating and alignment pins affix tool mounts reliably and repeatably.
High-grade, machined aluminum frame, designed for the lightest weight and smallest footprint possible.
Only 16mm deep when closed.
Weighs only 110g completely assembled(!)
USA-engineered and manufactured.
We faced some early challenges in developing firmware that would be fully functional for 3D printers with 8-bit boards and limited memory (such as the Creality Ender-3). We're working with Marlin firmware developers who have performed careful changes to Marlin bugfix-2.0.x with improved ergonomics and features, and will be releasing specific firmware branches for specific popular machines, as well as documentation for customizing the firmware yourself.

Customizing Tool Heads
Programming settings for different tools is as easy as modifying your slicer G-code, or saving those parameters to the machine's SD card or firmware config files. Configuring new tools is done by defining the following parameters:
Example toolhead configuration options in G-code.

The firmware is currently in a very functional state, with many of Marlin’s core functions enabled, with more improvements to be rolled out over time. Some of these changes / features have been rolled into the latest official Marlin bugfix-2.0.x, while we’re further refining things like LCD menu selections for tool changes, tool head settings, etc.

We’ve chosen Marlin because it’s the firmware that runs most of the world’s 3D printers. That said, we’re interested in adding more firmware options to the mix, and if you want to help develop something, let us know as we’d love to support you (as long as we're not spreading ourselves too thinly).

3D Printer Belt Length Chart
Last updated on December 18th
Rough timeline of XChange development, 2019 - 2020. Predicted Kickstarter fulfillment window 2021.



Production
Initial production on XChange is due to begin on January 2nd, 2021. Manufacturing certain parts in volume will require fancy new high-volume fixturing, which we'll be taking delivery of after the completion of the campaign. We'll keep our backers updated on our progress as we move forward.

Is XChange open source?
Not at this stage, but we're working on ways to do so, at least with much of the XChange ecosystem. We will be publishing CAD, firmware, and supporting our backers, makers, hackers and developers in creating useful modifications. Wherever we can offer support to talented and inclined individuals, we intend to do so.

Shipping and Fulfillment
Currently, we ship internationally via USPS, UPS and DHL. Domestic shipping within the USA for most of our current customers is typically around $7.50 - $8.50 USD, while international rates vary (most shipments cost under $20 for the label, not including VAT and duties).
Between now and the time of fulfillment, we'll be working with third party fulfillment and logistics partners in an effort to bring even better value international shipping. As is with our current policies, we will not be marking shipping up at all, and will pass along the lowest possible rates to our customers.
PrinterMods has been a USA-based manufacturer and retailer of 3D printer parts and upgrades since late 2018, and is made up of a team of talented, highly caffeinated makers, industrial designers and manufacturing specialists.

Over the last two years, we’ve proudly grown to serve tens of thousands of customers in more than 50 countries around the world, and have earned a reputation for our valuable, unique products and unwavering commitment to customer service.

We have our own manufacturing, production, and fulfillment facilities (located in FL and AL). All of our products are designed, engineered, and fulfilled by us in-house.

During the course of development of XChange, we’ve closely collaborated with various industry leaders and experts. We're grateful to all of them for supporting our efforts. 

Samtec - Manufacturer of very high quality electrical connectors, trusted in critical industries around the globe. We worked with Samtec to spec the ideal connectors for XChange, and validate our designs.

Insanity Automation - Marlin firmware developers and automation experts. We teamed up with their team to do initial firmware development, and are continuing to work with them to offer ongoing updates to our backers.

Slice Engineering - Makers of some of the finest 3D printer hot ends on the planet. We've collaborated with them to ensure XChange is ready to support their catalog of offerings, and will continue to do so in the future.


Why Kickstarter?
We’re using Kickstarter as a platform for a soft launch of XChange prior to a full-fledged consumer launch. By using Kickstarter, we can control the exact number of XChange units we’re manufacturing, without over-committing ourselves. It also provides an efficient platform through which we can interact directly with our backer community, and help empower you to do amazing things with XChange.

Our backers should expect communications from us on pertinent manufacturing, production and fulfillment updates along the way. We ask that backers be willing to give us constructive feedback when using XChange, and together help us further refine and improve it for everyone to enjoy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve already addressed a number of challenges during the lengthy development of XChange, and we’ve generally spared no expense to ensure we’re making the highest quality, safest, most manufacturable and functional version of XChange that we can.

#1 - Manufacturing
This is a BIG one, and proves to be a problem for many starry-eyed Kickstarter creators. We’re confident in our ability to produce XChange… because we are the manufacturer. We have a fully-equipped facility in which we currently produce all of our other CNC-machined parts for existing catalog of products. We’ve created and tested the machine programs, invested in custom tooling, designed high-volume fixturing (we even have backup fixturing)... all in an effort to ensure that we can produce XChange on-time for our Kickstarter backers.

#2 - Packaging
We’ve left this for last in our product development process because in addition to requiring us to know the very final form factor of XChange (and included accessories, etc.), our first priority is providing a high quality product. That said, we are actively working with a partner on developing some cool packaging that is not expected to cause any delays with our fulfillment.

#3 - Fulfillment
Over the two years we’ve been operating PrinterMods, we’ve learned a ton about efficient packing, production, and fulfillment. We foresee no fulfillment-related delays with our pre-established processes, and are well-equipped to course correct in the event of unforeseeable circumstances (we’re looking at you, global pandemics).

#4 - The current state of world affairs...
We're all sick of talking about it at this point, but this really is an unusual time in history. Successfully developing a product is hard enough as it is, and it's made all the more challenging with the looming threat of global pandemics, unstable economies, and lockdowns. Even during the XChange development process, we felt the repercussions of these global changes because, much like everyone else, we're at the mercy of some of these realities. Even something as simple as postal carrier shipping delays can impact many aspects of production at once, causing delays. We promise to never use this as a crutch or excuse for not doing our jobs to the very best of our abilities, but do ask for an extra helping of patience and support from our backer community as we navigate these uncharted waters.

#5 - Shipping (carrier) delays
When it comes to actually fulfilling the product, we're pretty great at our jobs. What we're not able to do is ensure that postal carriers (and governments / Customs divisions of numerous countries) do their jobs as well as we do. As experienced as we are with international fulfillment (a significant portion of our existing sales are overseas), it is simply outside of our control. We will be doing what we can between now and the time of fulfillment to create favorable international shipping options, and to offer our customers flexibility in carrier choice and shipping method as is possible. Please, check with your individual governments and carrier of choice to understand what, if any, delays they may be experiencing, and to fully understand your government's laws pertaining to import, VAT, duties, and the like. We will always do our best to assist with this as we are able, but ultimately it is the responsibility of the backer.

#6 - Stretch goals?
We are not beginning this campaign with any particular stretch goals in mind. If we do decide to introduce stretch goals (which is unclear at this point), we will focus only on options that do not directly affect the scope of XChange's production. Changes to our core product that do not constitute incremental improvements to XChange, or that would negatively affect our design for manufacture (DFM) will not be put forth. These goals can be pursued separately from the Kickstarter platform, after we deliver on our core promises.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
XChange is designed to last the lifetime of your machine. We foresee it being a valuable part of your 3D printing routine.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #9 - Shipping has begun(!), CoreXY updates, and more.
updates.update_content:
Fulfillment Updates
We have begun sending out backer surveys for the March and April reward tiers. Already, about 86% of you have completed that survey, and we appreciate how quickly so many of you have gotten back to us. If your estimated reward delivery was for March or April and you have not received your survey, please check your spam/junk mail filter. The survey can only be sent once (this is a Kickstarter limitation), so please reach out to us right away if you have any problems completing it.

Manufacturing begins ahead of schedule
We're happy to announce that we've been able to begin manufacturing slightly ahead of schedule! Now that the final tool plate designs are done, we expect to have drawings of the assembly available for backers within several days. We will update everyone as soon as it's ready.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #7 - Fulfillment Updates and Backer Surveys
updates.update_content:
We have a lot to tell you about!
Improved PCB designs
Docking station and the future of the automatic changing project
 Compatibility expands 
Master assembly add-on reward
XChange V1.0 Giveaway Contest - only two days remain!

From the bottoms of our geeky hearts, thank you.
It's extremely gratifying for our team that, after more than a year of tight-lipped silence on this project, you all love it as much as we'd hoped you would. We are excited for the future, and can't wait to see how you're going to use XChange.

project_data.project_name: XChange V1.0 - The Quick-Change Tool Head for Any 3D Printer

campaign.story:
SimplyColor3D 2.0 is an app that converts single color 3D models into MultiColor 3D models. Users can paint any 3D model in the app, then convert the model into  a MultiColor 3D model and download that model for MultiColor 3D printing. It works with every Slicer and 3D Printer.  
The output from SimplyColor3D 2.0 can be imported into any 3D slicer. It can be used for 3D printing on FDM or sandstone printers, and it can be uploaded to Shapeways or similar 3D printing services.
SimplyColor3D 2.0 automatically unwraps 3D models. Because of the UV maps, any models painted with SimplyColor3D 2.0 will work with all other graphics applications (i.e. Marmoset, Lightroom, Photoshop, Dimensions, Zbrush, Hexels, Sketchfab, Shapr3D, Keyshot, etc.). The assortment of features in SimplyColor3D 2.0 makes it truly easy to paint any 3d model.
Absolute Zero, Painted in SimplyColor3D 2.0, pictured in Marmoset (credit Arcane Wonders)
Making MultiColor models is DIFFICULT!
With over a MILLION models it's no wonder that most 3D printer users rely on Thingiverse.com for content, but there are less than a thousand MultiColor models on Thingiverse.  As more people are buying MultiColor capable 3D printers the demand for MultiColor models is growing.
The normal method to convert a single body 3D model into a MultiColor model is to cut it into different pieces,  using a software program like NetFabb and Meshmixer. Other applications allow the user to paint the model, but they don't work with every slicer and every 3D printer.
The only way to solve the problem is to enable easy conversion to MultiColor. That way anyone can make any 3D model a MultiColor model. This requires software for painting and converting existing 3D models.
Since there are no easy tools that support preparing MultiColor models for 3D printing, we took on this challenge and created SimplyColor3D 2.0  - the world's best integrated solution for painting and converting MultiColor 3D models.  We make MultiColor 3D easier!
 Introducing ...

SimplyColor3D allows anyone, of any skill level, to turn a single-body  3D model into a MultiColor 3D model, for 3D printing in multiple colors easily. All the 3D models that you design, all the models on  thingiverse.com, and all the other online model repositories, can be  colored & split with SimplyColor3D and 3D printed in multiple colors on any 3D  Printer. This enables a level of freedom and customization never before  seen. Every 3D model is now a MultiColor model. Every model can be  colored unlimited times in different colors too. 

For those of you who are familiar with SimplyColor3D 1.0 here is a short list of the upgrades we have included in SimplyColor3D 2.0:
Split by color: Output in 3MF or STL
Directly download to your computer
Now supports ALL 3D printers and EVERY slicer.
Fill by region
Global color replace
Island color replace
Stamping: Default and custom images
revised interface
Favorite colors palette
Save work online
model gallery
Photoshop style layers
Custom backgrounds
Take snapshot
3D rotation orientation cube
Easy help requests
Built in tutorial videos
Do you want to see how to use SimplyColor3D 2.0?  In our Update#6 we show how to use each of the painting tools.
Here is a little more detail on the user interface:
We think it's important that SimplyColor3D adheres the industry  standard way of doing things. That's why we use unwrapped Obj files with  texture map png's. Models that are painted with SimplyColor3D are compatible with leading programs like Blender, Maya, 3DS,  Rhino, and Zbrush.
SimplyColor3D has a main window where the 3D model is displayed. On the left hand side is the main menu where models can be saved and loaded, and painting features selected.
Main interface window
The Gallery shows rotating snapshots of previously saved painted models. 
Gallery
 Custom backgrounds may be loaded, and Screenshots can be exported with a single click of the mouse.
Take a screenshot
The color can be selected by either entering the exact RGB color code or  by picking from a color wheel, or by using a color picker for selecting  a color that is already painted on the model. This way the user can  work with a standard set of colors easily switching between them.  Colors may be saved to the Favorites palette.
Color selection menu
The Fill by region feature divides the model into paintable areas by the edges of the model. Clicking on an area will fill the entire region with the color selected. 
Color pick & Fill by region
Island color replace only replaces the color you click on, up to the border of the color which surrounds it. 
Island color replace
Global color replace, switches one color for another, everywhere it appears in the model. 
Global color replace
Stamping, paints an image on the model. Stamp with default images, text, or copy from the model, or you may stamp with any uploaded image.
Stamping

Once you are happy with the look of your model you can convert it to MultiColor for FDM 3D printing. Simply click the “SPLIT” button and the MultiColor version of the model will download directly to your computer.
The model is now ready to be imported into your favorite slicing program, like PrusaSlicer or Simplify3D.
Alternatively, you can download the OBJ, MTL, and texture PNG file which can be used to print in full color on Sandstone or Material Jetting 3D printers.
Split model converts the model to MultiColor for FDM 3D printing
Models that have been converted for FDM 3D printing now have each color region defined in their file. These regions can be assigned to different color filaments in your slicing program. Below shows the each color section expanded in Windows 10 3D viewer. 
Separate bodies in 1 file for FDM 3D printing

Covid-19 (thing:4166787): Painted, converted to MultiColor, and 3D printed
Mike Wazowski (Thing:4187763): Painted, converted to MultiColor, and 3D printed
SimplyColor3D 2.0 is unique among 3D applications. It is the only application that allows automatic conversion to MultiColor. It also has many unique painting tools and other features that make the coloring process fun, simple, and easy. Here are some of the features that set SimplyColor3D 2.0 apart from the competition:
Arcane Wonders is a board game company. They are currently running a Kickstarter campaign for The Freedom Five. Here a few time-lapse videos of their models being painted in SimplyColor3D 2.0, and side-by-side spins of the graphical models beside their material-jetting 3D printed counterparts. (renders from Marmoset)
Models with Toonie (Candian $2 coin) for scale
Left Digital / Right 3D printed:
PLAY

 Left Digital / Right 3D printed:  
PLAY

3Dowl model by Satoshi painted in SimplyColor3D: 
Lost Wizard model by Fabelzel

SimplyColor3D is a Cloud application, which means it runs in your  browser and doesn't require any software to be installed on your  computer. It supports all operating systems (Windows, Mac, Linux) and a  wide range of hardware. To run SimplyColor3D your computer must have the  following capabilities:
Operating system: Windows, Mac, Linux
Browsers: 100% Tested with Chrome
CPU:  3ghz dual core i5
Memory: 16GB
OpenGL: Must support at least OpenGL V3.3
Graphics card: GTX1050 or better
Internet connection: 10mb/s
Professional graphics drawing tablet (Optional)
There are 4 pledge levels:
Pricing after the Kickstarter:
Subscription MSRP: $60/year.
Lifetime unlimited access MSRP: $200.
If you pledge during the Kickstarter then you can take advantage of significant savings:
OPTION ONE: 1 Year Unlimited Access:
Start: $25 (Save 58%)
Increase: +$5 for every 100 backers
OPTION TWO: 2 Year Unlimited Access: 
start: $45 ( Save   62%)
Increase +$5 for every 100 backers
OPTION THREE: 3 Year Unlimited Access:
Start: $60 ( Save   66%)
Increase: +5 for every 100 backers
OPTION FOUR: Lifetime unlimited access:
Start: $100 (50% Savings)
Increase: +5 for every 50 backers

SimplyColor3D will be rolled out to Kickstarter backers in the order  they pledged. The length of time it takes for the backer roll-out will  depend on the number of backers. There will be a period of time where we  will onboard everyone and work with them to ensure that the platform is  stable before it is made available to the public. This will probably  take about 3 months before the general public will be allowed to  subscribe to the service and access SimplyColor3D.
After the current Kickstarter backers are on-boarded then SimplyColor3D 1.0 backers will be phased into SimplyColor3D 2.0. If you want to be moved to the front of the line and get access right away then you could always pledge again to further support the project =D
We will continue to further improve SimplyColor3D with the Kickstarter funds we received from this campaign: Which is the exact same thing we did with the funds from the SimplyColor3D 1.0 Kickstarter campaign (plus more money from our own pockets...who knew software development was soooo expensive?....).  We implemented many of the features that we mentioned in this section from the V1 campaign (plus a whole bunch more) like:
Auto convert STL to the OBJ file format
Direct download
Improved freestyle paint brush
Custom stamps
Fill by region
Here is a sneak peek into our future development schedule:
Speed Optimizations
Thingiverse.com integration direct Import -> paint -> remix
Sketchfab bridge integration
New export file type (DAE, WRL, and more)
Model transformations (i.e. scaling, cutting)
Advanced drawing tools (i.e. Lasso, improved fill by region, square brush)
Section views
Magnifying glass
Keyboard bindings from standard applications
Mirror painting
Enhanced gallery with cloud backup
SimplyColor3D 2.0 Kickstarter - Release and future development timeline

Tachyon, Painted in SimplyColor3D 2.0, pictured in Marmoset (credit Arcane Wonders)
SimplyColor3D enables everyone to be a graphic design artist. It's so easy that young or old, professional or hobbyist, anyone can turn boring single color models into exciting MultiColor 3D models.
If you want to convert single color 3D models to MultiColor then SimplyColor3D is for you.
If you need to easily color 3D models then SimplyColor3D is for you.
If you want to 3D Print MultiColor models then SimplyColor3D is for you.
We believe that 3D printing should be colorful.  We need your support  to bring SimplyColor3D 2.0 - the simplest and most intuitive way to produce  MultiColor models for 3D printing - to the WORLD!.
With your pledge we will grant you early access to SimplyColor3D 2.0 and  use the money to further the development of SimplyColor3D and our  mission to make every 3D model MultiColor.
Please make a pledge today and help bring SimplyColor3D to life =D
Thank you to Arcane Wonders for permission to display the excellent models from your game, and thanks to Stephen G. for painting the models.

With our 1st Kickstarter there were some challenges in delivery. Those hosting issues were resolved and every backer received access to the application. 100% of backers received what they paid for.

With version 2.0 we've already proactively hosted the new version and inducted previous backers to test it. That test was successful. 

For these reasons, you can be certain you will receive quick access to SimplyColor3D 2.0 if you back our project.

campaign.env:

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Because it's software SimplyColor3D 2.0 will last forever.
Reusability and recyclability
You can use SimplyColor3D forever and it will never wear out. If you need to recycle it just hit F5 on your keyboard.
Sustainable materials
SimplyColor3D 2.0 is made from 100% Sustainable Javascript code.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our software development studio outputs zero chemicals or toxins into the environment. It's ROHS compliant, and all our labor practices are in compliance with International Labor laws.
Sustainable Distribution
We commit to absolutely zero(0) carbon emissions in the shipment, distribution, and fulfillment of our virtual product SimplyColor3D 2.0

updates.update_userinfo: SimplyColor3D 2.0 Paint & Print Contest! Win $100 USD!
SimplyColor3D 2.0 Update #20: HUGE NEWS! Rewards are COMPLETELY 100% DELIVERED for Kickstarter AND preorder customers!!!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers! 
This is a BIG update!! 
We've now inducted all Kickstarter backers! Yay! The Kickstarter campaign is completely fulfilled!

updates.update_userinfo: SimplyColor3D 2.0 Update #19: We are adding backers again starting today!
updates.update_content:
The multi user errors seems to be resolved. We hammered the server with hundreds of simultaneous requests and there were zero errors. 
Splitting models is significantly improved. You should be able to get 3D printable splits for most models. If there is any defect then reducing the color penetration depth a little (2-3 mm) should help. 
We are still working on the timeout issue for splitting larger models, or those with very low layer height (<.2mm). This is 99% done and will be tested and implemented in the next day or two. We'll update you then.

Hello Backers, 
There are four issues we are working on.
 1) Model splitting defects.  
2) Paint brush not working properly when zoomed in.

Hi Backers, 
We are 1/2 way through inducting backers, the application has been working for many users, BUT we've gotten many support requests where things are not working properly also.  We are going to pause granting access until we resolve the current issues. These are hopefully not really large problems but there is a high likelihood that many more people will experience the same problems and there is no point in throwing users into the same issues. We will adjust the access granting timelines on the spreadsheet once we've got the current support requests under control.

updates.update_userinfo: SimplyColor3D 2.0 Update 16: Next 30 backers have been granted access
updates.update_content:
Good afternoon Backers, 
Good news!  We have now granted access to the next 30 people on this list: SimplyColor3D 2.0 - Backer & Customer release order google sheet
The  Multi-Color conversion is up and running. Though it still has some  issues, we are working around the clock to resolve it. Right now we are  seeing some small gaps in the skins of some models. But the issue of  large missing segments seems to be resolved. We've also added a new  feature "Color Penetration Depth" which allows the user to select how  deep the color goes into the model.  The default is 3.2mm. Going too shallow or too deep may cause a bad result but it's  also model dependent. At least this gives some flexibility for those experimenting with see through color variations.

Good morning backers! 
Quick update to let you know that the first 30 backers were granted access late last night. They have access now. If you are one of the 30, you may need to change your password.  Please visit our website www.bigbrain3d.com and click the link as per the image below.  There are how to videos within the app to help you get started.  We will be here to work with you as you learn the program.  We are VERY excited to work with these first 30 backers.  We want your experience to be a positive one, so with that said if you have any questions please reach out at and we will be happy to help/teach you how to use the various tools.  We will be posting some new painting videos shortly, and scheduling some "how to" live stream sessions as well in the near future.

Hello everyone,
Ok...So the missing segment fix is still not complete. The main developer working on that issue has gotten sick (not Covid!!) and needs a couple days off. We did make really good progress this week and are only a few days from completing the 1 remaining task. It should be done next week. Please keep your hopes/dreams/wishes/prayers with him.
We've decided to move forward with the roll out anyway. The 'Split model' multi-color conversion feature will remain offline until the bug is fixed. But all the other features will be fully functional. We will induct the first set of thirty(30) backers tomorrow (Sunday Jan 10th). Then starting on the 17th of Jan we're going to grant access to 30 backers every day. We will pause if major issues are discovered. At this rate everyone have access by Feb 14th.

updates.update_userinfo: SimplyColor3D 2.0 Update 13: Check back here tomorrow
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers, 
We've been back at it this week and we will be posting a new update tomorrow for you with phase 1 access details :) Please make sure to check back here for more info.
- BigBrain3D team

Good Evening Backers, 
Just a very brief message to say Happy New Year!  
Because of Christmas and New Years - development this week was a  bit of a wash.  We'll pick up again on Monday :) Look for an update and release info soon!  We are VERY close to giving access to the first backers.  Thank you for your patience over the holidays.

project_data.project_name: SimplyColor3D 2.0 - Convert any 3D model into MultiColor

campaign.story:
Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | PressKit | YouTube 
 Your 3D printer is your new kitchen assistant
Cakewalk 3D is a precise, effective and handy upgrade that converts your desktop 3D printer into a food printer. It enables you to unleash your creativity in the kitchen, producing detailed shapes in a few minutes which would take the best chef a couple hours to design.

Finish up your meal like never before
Do you want to save time and impress your hosts with fine dining? If so, the Cakewalk 3d is the perfect printing device for you.
More than just another paste extruder, Cakewalk 3D is an all-included box designed by a French pastry chef. Find everything you need to print out your vision: ingredients, silicone baking mat, food-safe extruder and detailed instructions to train yourself on your first 3D prints. You will quickly achieve amazing results.


Never fail a birthday cake
We've all failed a cake design at least once in our life. Now you can create your own cake lace patterns, or custom decorations that you can add on the top of the next birthday cake. Thanks to the nozzle of 1 mm you can 3D print delicate cake designs or unique treats that no one will ever find in a store.

3D Print stunning appetizers
What about designing fun shapes on your computer and 3D print them on crackers for an astonishing cocktail ? We provide you recipes and ingredients to succeed in your first prints, and let you be the inventor of new snacks.
Create incredible plates like a star-rated chef
If you don't feel like a member of the piping bag world champion league, or will never graduate from any fancy chef schools, Cakewalk 3d is your ally to accomplish star-rated chef recipes.  Like your own personal kitchen assistant, Cakewalk 3d lets you focus on cooking while it takes care of the rest.

Convert your leftovers into savory prints
Let’s face it, there’s no much fun in eating the leftovers. Now you can mash them and use Cakewalk 3d to turn them into savory snacks. A brocoli-based crocodile or a parsnip-carrot unicorn looks more appetizing for everyone. 
 Cakewalk3d is really easy to set up into your own 3D printer and works like your regular plastic extruder.
Cakewalk3d works with Creality, Anet, Anycubic, Alfawise, Prusa… and any FDM printer
Cakewalk 3d fully supports dozens of 3D cartesian printers.  We have successfully tested on major brands such as Creality, Anycubic, Alfawise, Prusa or Anet...  We provide instructions and the 3D files  for free download, that will fit for a wide range of 3D printers.

A new chapter in your 3D printing journey
To adapt Cakewalk 3d to your printer, all you need is to 3D print 3 supporting parts:
1 connector between the cartridge and the Nema motor
  2 detachable rings to hold the cartridge
  The prints take less than 10 hours to complete on most desktop 3D printers and the CAD files are available for download. We can handle it for you if needed, using professional powder-based 3D printing technology for better accuracy.
 Over the past weeks, we gathered feedbacks from makers to food-lovers accross various fablabs, incubators and cooking schools.
"Innovation and a lot of fun for our first workshop" @Fablab ESILV
"A new step in our cooking journey and a milestone for the curry sauce!" @Fablab CentraleSupelec
"Cakewalk 3d is the first step into the stimulating and inspiring world of 3D food printing!" @SmartFoodParis
Tricky to see people smiling behind masks, still eyes were lit with wonder! 
 We believe everyone is creative. So we've designed Cakewalk3d to be simple enough for anyone to use. 
Whether you're a professional creator or a weekend tinkerer, the Cakewalk3d is a powerful tool for bringing your food ideas to life.
You can use your favorite 3D slicer in order to prepare your masterpieces, just like you would normally do for any kind of prints. 

To help everyone with the first steps, we include an ingredient mix in every box (you can choose between French meringue, vegan meringue, or salted veggie mix). And the 3D files of our best recipes are available on the major 3D marketplaces.

Feel confused? Our support group on Facebook got you covered. You're welcome to join here!
 Maker Kit   = extruder + 1 silicone mat + 1 food mix sachet 49 €
Standard Kit = Maker kit + couplers + motor Nema 17 + screws  89 €
Best Value kit = Standard kit + support parts already 3D printed and assembled + 2 extra ingredients 129 €
Cakewalk 3D + 3D Printer bundle: for those who don’t own a 3D printer, the Best value kit will be assembled and ready to be installed on the 3D printer included.
Compatible materials
Cakewalk3d works with many different recipes, as long as they meet the required viscosity. We have successfully 3d printed with:
Chocolate
Meringue
Vegetable puree
Ketchup
Guacamole
Honey
If you don't know what to start with, no worries. A tested food mix will be included with every reward, you' ll just need to add water and you can start to print right away! 3 food mix recipes are already available: salted veggie mix, french meringue or vegan meringue.
A recipes guide with the detailed steps and the setting profile for your favorite slicers will be also included and constantly updated on our website.
Safety in the kitchen
We designed Cakewalk3d with food safety as a priority, and selected the best material for the mechanical parts. Only food-grade stainless steel, silicone and PP will be in contact with your food. All parts can go to the dishwasher and will be certified.
We also include a silicone baking mat in order to protect the bed of your 3d printer and get a food printing space as safe as possible.

Easy to use
Using Cakewalk 3d doesn’t mean you will never 3D print plastic anymore. It takes less than 30 minutes to remove your extruder and install the new device. Cakewalk is working as an extruder so there’s no need to change anything on the connections on your card or even your firmware. Slicing profiles are provided for selected materials.
Open design
We chose to make our products extendable, upgradable, and easy to maintain.
Except the food-safe core parts of the extruder, most parts are standard spare parts that can be sourced. This campaign is designed to help us fund the injection molds for the core parts.
3D Printing lovers are part of a strong community and we hope that more and more makers will experiment and promote food printing thanks to Cakewalk 3d. We’re eager to get feedback and don’t worry we’ll be always here to help!

Hi, my name is Marine. I’m a 3D printing executive, a graduated pastry chef, and the creator of Cakewalk 3d. I live in Paris, France.
I love innovating with food and that's why I started Cakewalk 3d, first as a side project during the spring. It all began when we were all quarantined in France, and I wanted to automate my own pastry techniques. With a mechanical engineer, we worked together remotely, each one testing and improving on its own 3D printer.  We gather our result daily, and we iterated over 3 months.
Once I started showing other pastry lovers the desserts I was getting, there was so much interest that I knew it was something I had to share with the whole 3D printing community. I worked and designed new recipes during months (mostly tested and approved by my coworkers!) and searched for the best production methods.
Even if I always want to 3D print everything, I came to the conclusion that the core parts of the extruder need to be injected. So I worked with an engineering team to select the best providers and design the molds. The campaign is aimed to raise enough money to pay these molds.
Thanks to your support, Cakewalk 3d will be soon in production, and I am really excited to share what we’ve built with the Kickstarter community.
If you’d like to see some of the designs and recipes I’ve been getting with Cakewalk 3D, you can find me on Instagram @marine_corebaillais
May 2020 : The first designs
May 2020 : First 3D printed parts
May 2020 : First prototype assembled
June 2020 : Corentin's trial on Creality Ender
July 2020 : New version on Marine's Anet 3D printer
July 2020 : Testing new recipes
PLAY

 July 2020 : First tests with chocolate
August 2020 : 3D Printing Chocolate on Thibault's Alfawise
September 2020: Prototype testing on Alfawise and Anycubic
September 2020 : Final version, ready for production
October 2020: Burger printing in progress...
 Help us spread the word and receive an extra ingredient in your box !

Share this with friends on Facebook.
  Share on Instagram.
  Mention and follow us on Twitter.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Manufacturing:
As the old saying goes: good tools for good works. We will make no compromise on quality, so we can deliver to you the best product. I have experienced production partners in France and I'm confident that we will be able to bring the product on schedule. If we reach enough volume, we may consider to manufacture on each continent, in order to secure our carbon footprint.

Team:
As you may have understood, I have been supporting personnally this project since the beginning and I would be happy to share it! I couldn't afford a full-time employee yet and this campaign will help my company to grow with a robust team.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The kit is working with any type of 3d slicer, you don't need to download a special software.
Reusability and recyclability

We will focus on reducing the packaging to what is strictly necessary and use eco-friendly materials.

campaign.story:
Pico Hybrid Packaging Design
Pico Hybrid is an upgraded hotend for your 3D printer. 
Pico Hybrid improves your printer's reliability, expands the types of materials you can print with, and lets you reach higher print speeds.


Parts printed using Pico Hybrid
Click here to view more prints 
Stiff, weak joints on conventional heater cartridges can cause wires to break, leading to print failures.
 Pico Hybrid's right-angle, metal-reinforced wiring ensures that you can keep printing without issues.
A 120 degree swivel on the heater adjusts to your mount, removing unnecessary strain on the wires.
A custom brass nut and strain relief spring protect the thermistor and ensure it stays seated firmly for consistent, reliable temperature reading.


 A sharp transition zone in the heat break prevents jams and clogs, no matter what material you print or how often you retract. 



Pico Hybrid can handle PLA, flexibles, abrasives, and engineering-grade filaments like Nylon and PEEK.
Printed with Pico Hybrid in TPU on Ender 3

Ender 3. PLA @ 150mm/s
E3D Toolchanger. PLA @ 300mm/s

Pico Hybrid prints faster than the E3D V6 and is on par with the Slice Engineering Mosquito when it comes to PLA flow rates. Enjoy fast print speed without all the ooze of a volcano!
Data collected from our custom-built Force Test Stand


Pico Hybrid eliminates the need to choose between two styles of hotend. Switch from PTFE-lined for PLA to All-Metal for more advanced materials easily with the swap of a nozzle.
PTFE-Lined Brass (Left), A2 Steel All-Metal (Right)

Remove the nozzle cold or hot. Put it in with your fingers, take it out with your fingers. No more wrenches.

When printing advanced materials, all-metal is the only way to go. 
When printing in PLA, PTFE liners still provide superior reliability, quality, and print speed due to PLA's unique properties. 
Rigid PTFE nozzle liners precision machined from virgin-grade PTFE rods
Additionally, our PTFE liners are precision machined from virgin-grade PTFE rod. Using machined PTFE instead of cheaper extruded PTFE tube allows for tighter tolerances and less thermal expansion during printing, which can constrict the filament.

Great print quality at high speeds with PLA is possible with Pico Hybrid. See for yourself.
Printed with Pico Hybrid on Ender 3 in Silk Blue PLA @ 150mm/s


Pico Hybrid with all electronics, and and its heat-break cooling fan weighs less than 20g! 

 *PT100 Thermistor required


All Pico Hybrids come standard with a removable groove mount adapter for easy mounting. Because it is removable, there are many other ways to mount Pico Hybrid!
Swapping from an E3D V6 hotend and worried about the height difference? Our E3D extension adapter makes the Pico Hybrid EXACTLY as long as the E3D V6, allowing you to save time on mounting and spend more time printing!
Prototype shown

Using an M6 heat-set insert in a printed part, you can attach a custom printed mount directly to the Pico Hybrid, unlocking unlimited mounting possibilities!
Pico Hybrid w/ integrated part cooling on Ender 3 using 3D-Printed Creality mount. Designed by Beta Tester John's 3D Printing Corner (Youtube)
3D-Printed SeeMeCNC SE300 Delta Mount. Pico Hybrid shown with integrated part cooling add-on. Printed by Beta Tester Practical Printing (Youtube)
You can find an STL of Pico Hybrid on Thingiverse if you want to start designing your own! Pico Hybrid Model


High-temp upgrade kit will be released shortly after initial backer delivery. Parts include a 60W reinforced heater, PT100 or Type K Thermistor, and a larger stainless steel heater block.
Early Prototype Shown
Our unique integrated part cooling attaches to the heat-break fan and is perfectly angled to cool your prints without the need for bulky fans and complicated 3D-printed fan ducts. Weighing only 5.6g, this add-on is small but mighty! It can keep up at print speeds as high as 100mm/s!
Mounts for older Makerbot and Reprap styles will be released shortly after initial backer delivery. In addition, we will design other mount styles by popular demand!


Available for purchase when we deliver to backers. Custom made mount and wire harness for Creality printers so that you can swap to Pico Hybrid with minimal effort, and no extra tools beyond what came with your printer are required!




We are beta testing the new Kickstarter add-on feature! Instead of building add-ons or additional units into pledges, you can chose any quantity of the following add-ons after you select your pledge! 

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarter launches with 1,400+ successful Kickstarter projects and over $500M raised in total.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there are always risks & challenges with creating and delivering a new product, we've minimized the risk by identifying most of our suppliers and manufacturers in advance. We have a few more suppliers to secure mainly around packaging design, which is not critical to the performance of the product. This means that our cost is well understood, and our local facility is already being prepared to assemble and ship units as soon as they arrive.

The one thing that may adversely affect delivery time is the Coronavirus effects on our Chinese suppliers. While most of our suppliers are back at work, many shipping lanes are still volatile. We are collaborating with our suppliers to work through this and will continue to monitor the situation closely, as well as inform our backers of any delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Reinforced and reliable components ensure that they will not need to be replaced as frequently, reducing the waste generated by the product over its lifetime.
Reusability and recyclability
Our packaging uses a windowed metal tin that can be reused for parts storage, reducing waste that the packaging would otherwise generate.
Sustainable Distribution
We are working with our suppliers to coordinate portions of our assembly and packaging in order to reduce the carbon footprint of our long-distance bulk shipping.

updates.update_content:
Delivery Timeline:
As promised in the last update, we will continue to give an estimate for delivery in each update from now on. As it currently stands, there is no additional update on delivery time and we are still expecting Q3.

Sourcing:

Delivery Timeline:
We have been hesitant to estimate an updated date for Pico Hybrid because we know it would be just that, an estimate. Our intention has been to allow backers to draw their own conclusion based on our detailed and transparent updates while trusting that we are doing everything in our power to move as quickly as we are able to.
However, some of you have made it clear that isn’t sufficient. Going forward, in addition to our detailed updates, we will speak to delivery timeframes from our perspective - as it relates to the progress we have made over the two week period, or what we have been told from our many suppliers.

Sourcing
Aaron is continuing to talk with our suppliers regarding pneumatic fitting design and packaging inserts. Heater manufacturing is well underway and we expect to be able to share photos of the finished product soon. Paul has received the sheet metal cooling bracket samples and they came out great so mass production will start on those as well.

Sourcing:
We have a few updates today on the remaining parts. The sheet metal fan shroud samples we got were beautiful and consistent. So much so, that we found an issue with our design specification because our previous prototypes did not actually match the specifications. The new samples did not fit with the heatsink. At all. We took a new look at the dimensions and tolerances, then tested them by modifying the samples on hand. We have refined the design, worked with the supplier to update the tooling, and have new samples already on the way!

Sourcing
The sheet metal fan shroud tooling has been fixed and the samples should be in this week for testing. It’s a really difficult part to make, so we think that our supplier did a great job here!

Surveys
There are still a number of you who have not completed your surveys. Make sure you get that done ASAP so we can ship your orders when they are ready! If you are unsure if you have completed it or haven’t seen the email, please reach out to us at support@metaform.us and we can help.

updates.update_userinfo: To B or not to B...
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!
It has been another crazy two weeks, some good some bad - here we go!

Sourcing
Sourcing is still moving along. Most of our remaining samples have arrived and are being tested. They all look pretty good and we are confident that they will move forward to full production. We are still waiting on the sheet metal parts and voltage regulator, but our supplier sent us a fantastic video of the heat break fan shrouds being stamped.

Title: Prepping for Production
Hey Backers!
First off, sorry we missed our normal update time on Tuesday. We got caught up working on time critical things for Pico Hybrid production. However, that means we have even more news for you today so let’s get to it.

Sourcing
Everything is going smoothly on the sourcing side. We are still waiting to confirm production samples for a pneumatic fitting, sheet metal parts, fan voltage regulators and heaters. Many of our suppliers were not able to start on these until March 1st. Thermistor production is scheduled to finish on March 31st and many of our other components are already done and waiting in a warehouse to ship.

We have also been working on packaging for nozzles. We took a cue from the machining industry and we like what we are seeing:

Sourcing
Chinese New Year has ended and all the factories are beginning to open back up. We have already contacted all our suppliers that have not begun production orders and are finalizing any details necessary for samples/production. To help speed up these discussions and ensure we minimize miscommunication, Aaron has solicited help from a generous Taiwanese classmate, Leo, who speaks Chinese. Leo has been making calls to the suppliers to ensure the details for production are correct and that things are moving on schedule. Assuming the remaining sample validation goes well, we expect to be done with all of the overseas production by late April.

campaign.story:
With the new models come new materials! 
We have chosen a new composite material with glass fiber, this special plastic blend translates into better mechanical properties especially in terms of elasticity and tensile strength.
Moreover, we are very excited to present you the first SPIRGRIPS® made with an innovative Carbon mixture. Lighter, stronger and stiffer as never before! 
This position has a huge impact on the cyclist's comfort by reducing joint and muscle pain.
 No matter if you are a pro or an amateur, if you climb mountains or just bike to work: SPIRGRIPS® + are easy to install on a wide range of bikes and you can benefit from them also biking just for few kilometers.   
PLAY

Numerous prototypes have been tested using the latest 3D printing technologies to validate the ergonomics of the new handle and ensuring its perfect integration on the handlebars available on the market.
SPIRGRIPS® + are the result of more than 10 years of research. These small bar grips are developed, tested, and scientifically validated in Switzerland in collaboration with professional cyclists.
 VALIDATED BY SCIENCE 
REDUCES VIBRATION IN ORDER TO PREVENT JOINT PAIN 
 NATURALLY ALIGN THE WRIST WITH THE ARM
We really care about ergonomics of course, but we never forget your safety. That's why we implemented the o-shape in order to prevent you from slipping, maintaining access to the brake every time.  
During the past years we had the chance to study the best materials for SPIRGRIPS® +, we have done several tests in order to reach these results and we are very excited to present you the new era of SPIRGRIPS® +.  
The shape - patented in Europe, the US and in China - is designed to correct the position of the hands, naturally aligning the joints of the forearms. Hand position has a huge impact on the cyclist's comfort and it's key in preventing joint and muscle pain. 
SPIRGRIPS® + is easy to mount. You just need a hex key. And your bike, of course.  
Fits: handlebars of racing bike, MTB, city bike with a diameter range between 22.2mm (0.87") and 31.8mm (1.25").
Weight: the estimated weight is below 70 gr for the composite version and approx 50gr for the carbon one.  
The pad is the novelty of the new model, its purpose is to give greater ergonomics and adapt more into the cyclist's hand. That’s why we realized this part with a low Shore material, very soft to the touch it will really turns every bike ride into true comfort. 
The pad can also be removed for saving more weight and increase the performances. 
We have developed an improved plastic blend with glass fiber. This special type of glass fiber translates into better mechanical properties especially in terms of elasticity and tensile strength. 
The product will be matt black
The carbon model is 40% lighter, it is stronger and stiffer while maintaining the same mechanical properties. It's made with a special blend with carbon fiber, making it the best choice for anyone seeking higher performances.  
Lobke Nijhoff - Pro cyclist
"The feeling I have when using SPIRGRIPS is relaxed. It takes the tension off the muscles in my arms. Because I like to travel long distances, I get less tired!"
Maxime Saonit — Pro MTB cyclist
"SPIRGRIPS, an object that has become essential for me on the World Marathon Series Events." 
Gaia Ravaioli - 24H Solo Wembo World Champion 2017
"Since I've started using SPIRGRIPS my wrists thank you!"  
PLAY

Frans Claes - Belgian Champion 2015 & 2016
"SPIRGRIPS helps me in my performance at races and gives my hands a more relaxing position while riding my bike." 
Christian Jupillat - UCI Masters Cyclo-Cross Senior World Champion
"I had the chance to test most of the innovations related to mountain biking. SPIRGRIPS impressed me with their comfort and thanks to them I've improved my performance every year. Having them on my bike is just essential, they are always with me. SPIRGRIPS + will be undoubtedly an innovation in lightness and comfort, I can't wait to try them" 

Life is colorful and so it could be your new SPIRGRIPS +! 
If we hit €50.000 as a stretch goal, we will be able to let you choose the color you like the most.  So, what's your favorite color?  


Pascal Badolett is a physiotherapist, he lives and works in Geneva, Switzerland, and he is very passionate about sports, especially cycling. In 2007, after a long ride with his MTB he experienced wrists and back pain. During his job, he noticed that many cyclists complained about the same issue after their training sessions, also noticing that many of them changed very often their hand's positions on the handlebars. From this intuition the idea of creating a new concept of handles bar that really helps cyclists in a more ergonomics and innovative way. Our mission is to correct your position ensuring the best ergonomics and safety in a way never experienced before. 
Join the SPIRGRIPS revolution, change the way you bike for good. 
PLAY

PLAY

SPIRGRIPS® + are the result of more than ten years of research. These inner bar grips are developed, tested, and scientifically validated in Switzerland in collaboration with professional cyclists. Numerous prototypes have been tested using the latest 3D printing technologies to validate the ergonomics of the new handle and ensuring its perfect integration on the handlebars available on the market. 
NEW SHIPPING RATES
Worldwide shipping available!  After the campaign, we will send a survey to all our backers in order to collect the diameter chosen and the shipping details. Shipping will be charged only after the campaign.  It is variable for every country and depends on the number of pledges made for each country, that's why we prefer to not make you pay in advance. We will give you the exact shipping rates and charge you just the right amount! We already can provide accurate estimates and we would do our best to not get rates higher than these.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Where we are now

The current prototypes, printed with 3D technology, are fully working in all the required features. We have spent the last six years engineering SPIRGRIPS® and testing new prototypes with athletes from all countries. We have meticulously collected their feedback and now we are ready to craft and distribute a new era of SPIRGRIPS®.
Anyhow, create a brand-new design using unreleased materials is a challenging task.
 
Where we are heading – Challenges

Manufacturing: the biggest challenge we face in this project is tooling the new mold. It will take about 3/4 weeks to make the molds we need, but we are confident that with our trusted manufacturing partner, Ecomold, we will hit the goal.

Timing

We decided to work hard already before our campaign in order to deliver on time.
We set up the whole supply-chain and most of our product development has been put in upfront.
Our goal is to ship in order to let you have your SPIRGRIPS®
 under the Christmas tree, and we are going to achieve it!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Press Release | Earn 10% cashback for every referral, by helping us spread the word
Please note that 
For Kickstarter, we are only offering the charger in a special Kickstarter edition BLACK color (see photos under Rewards section below). White color chargers are for illustrative purposes and may be offered later at retail after fulfillment for Kickstarter is completed.
We will only be shipping rewards to USA/Canada addresses for this project. We will not offer International (outside USA/Canada) shipping for this project due to unpredictable postal shipping times and costs as a result of COVID-19.
We do not recommend using plug adapters for this charger as plug adapters are generally not rated for 1500W pass-through power and will not support the stacking ability of this charger. As such, we will also not be offering any plug adapters for this charger. This further reinforces our decision not to offer International shipping.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused to our international backers. As an alternative solution, you can get our bestselling, most crowdfunded 100W GaN Charger with free International plug adapters for 30% off here (discount applied at checkout) which will more than enough pay for any courier express shipping that is less affected by COVID-19 restrictions. The promo expires on 10/25/2020.
++
9to5mac: Hands-on HyperJuice Stackable GaN 
 The Verge: "More Impressive Than Its Last"
 SlashGear: "The Holy Grail of Chargers" 
++
From the makers of the bestselling GaN Charger 
In 2019, HYPER created the world's first and smallest 100W GaN charger which went on to raise over $3.3M between Kickstarter and Indiegogo, making it the world's most crowdfunded and bestselling GaN charger product. Now from Hyper...
Comes an even smaller and better GaN charger
Smaller than a tiny box of mints
HyperJuice 65W
HyperJuice 100W
More than 20% smaller than the previous model with more power, features & USB-C ports 
Available in 2 sizes (65W and 100W)
HyperJuice 65W with 3 charging ports (2 x USB-C and 1 x USB-A)
HyperJuice 100W with 4 charging ports (3 x USB-C and 1 x USB-A)
65W charges 3 devices (2 x USB-C & 1 x USB-A)
Quick charge a laptop, tablet, and smartphone all at the same time.
100W charges 4 devices (3 x USB-C & 1 x USB-A)
Quick charge a laptop, tablet, smartphone, and USB device all at the same time. 
Bulky chargers can fall off the wall power outlet
HyperJuice with foldable pins stay close to the wall
So they will never fall off. 
With built-in outlet that supports up to 1500W
Rated at 1500W, it can power the most demanding electronics and appliances. HyperJuice uses a power outlet but also gives one back. Easily insert HyperJuice into any situation even when there are no available power outlets.
Fighting over a single power outlet?
Gone are the days of running out of available power outlets. HyperJuice does everything from a single outlet. 
HyperJuice stacks upon itself and let you power multiple laptops from a single power outlet
Power 4 laptops from a single power outlet and even more... 
Stack up to 16 chargers for 1600W of power
HyperJuice Stackable Chargers are rated to pass through 1500W of power so you can stack a total of 16 x 100W chargers to create a 1600W supercharger with 48 x USB-C and 16 x USB-A ports, all over a single power outlet. 
Smaller than every other 100W charger out there
Smaller than Anker Atom PD 4 (100W), Apple 96W, Apple 61W & HyperJuice 100W 2C2A (2019)
Powered by the latest Gallium Nitride (Navitas GaNFast) Technology 
HyperJuice utilizes the industry-leading Navitas GaNFast NV6125/NV6127 Power IC to miniaturize components normally found in traditional chargers. The new Gallium Nitride semiconductor material allows for power devices that can operate at higher voltages and switching frequency which results in smaller and more efficient chargers.
See the following video to learn more about GaN:
Sophisticated Design (Worldwide Patented)
HYPER is the pioneer of delivering 100W of power in a GaN charger and we have been working for almost a year perfecting the circuit design and firmware to fully utilize the Navitas GaNFast NV6125/NV6127 Power IC to bring the HyperJuice charger to fruition.
We want to make the smallest 65W and 100W charger ever so the circuit board and components are laid out in the most compact and space-efficient manner. Only the industry's most efficient components that can deliver the best performance in the smallest of space are used. The dense circuit board is then surrounded by high-density thin heat sinks to aid in heat dissipation. The entire package is then wrapped in a minimalist fire-resistant polycarbonate enclosure to complete the efficient design.
HyperJuice 65W Exploded View
HyperJuice 65W Exploded View
HyperJuice 100W Exploded View
HyperJuice 100W Exploded View
Proof of Concept Video
The following single shot unedited video of working prototypes of the HyperJuice 65W and 100W Stackable GaN Chargers demonstrate that even after stacking 3 chargers over a single power outlet, it is able to pass through more than 1600W of power to power a water kettle and each HyperJuice 65W/100W charger is still able to provide the maximum power of 65W and 100W respectively.
PLAY

Product Specifications
HyperJuice 65W and HyperJuice 100W

HyperJuice 65W
HyperJuice 65W smaller than a tiny box of mints
 Product Dimensions: 72 x 36 x 30.5mm / 2.83" x 1.42" x 1.2"
 Product Weight: 103.8g / 3.66oz / 0.23 lb
 Power Input: AC 100-240V 50/60Hz 2.4A
 Power Outlet Rating: 1500W
 Max USB Power Output: 65W
 Power Efficiency: 95%
 Ports: 2 x USB-C and 1 x USB-A
 USB-C1: 65W Power Delivery 3.0, PPS 3.3~21V3.23A, 5/9/12/15V3A, 20V3.25A
 USB-C2: 65W Power Delivery 3.0, PPS 3.3~21V3.23A, 5/9/12/15V3A, 20V3.25A
 USB-A1: SCP 3.4~5V, Quick Charge 3.0, 5V/3A, 9V/2A, 12V/1.5A
 Protocol: BC1.2, Apple 2.4A, AFC, FCP, SCP, QC2.0/3.0/4.0+, PD2.0/3.0, PPS
 PCBA Structure: HQR GaN
 GaN IC: Navitas 6125
 Protection: Over-current, Over-voltage, Over-temperature, Short-circuit Protection
HyperJuice 100W
HyperJuice 100W smaller than a box of mints
 Product Dimensions: 85.4 x 45 x 30.5mm / 3.36" x 1.77" x 1.2"
 Product Weight: 166.1g / 5.86oz / 0.37 lb
 Power Input: AC 100-240V 50/60Hz 2.4A
 Power Outlet Rating: 1500W
 Max USB Power Output: 100W
 Power Efficiency: 95%
 Ports: 3 x USB-C and 1 x USB-A
 USB-C1: 100W Power Delivery 3.0, PPS 3.3~21V3.23A, 5/9/12/15V3A, 20V5A
 USB-C2: 100W Power Delivery 3.0, PPS 3.3~21V3.23A, 5/9/12/15V3A, 20V5A
 USB-C3: 100W Power Delivery 3.0, PPS 3.3~21V3.23A, 5/9/12/15V3A, 20V5A
 USB-A1: SCP 3.4~5V, Quick Charge 3.0, 5V3A, 9V2A, 12V1.5A
 Protocol: BC1.2, Apple 2.4A, AFC, FCP, SCP, QC2.0/3.0/4.0+, PD2.0/3.0, PPS
 PCBA Structure: HQR GaN
 GaN IC: Navitas 6127
 Protection: Over-current, Over-voltage, Over-temperature, Short-circuit Protection
Rewards
In order to simplify Kickstarter reward fulfillment so that we can get all the chargers out to everyone as soon as possible, we are only offering the charger in a special Kickstarter edition BLACK color (see photos below). We love Black and many backers have asked for Black for our previous project because Black color is more stain-resistant in the long run. White color chargers are for illustrative purposes and may be offered later at retail after fulfillment for Kickstarter is completed. Please understand that having multiple color choices, especially for different chargers within the same reward will just complicate and delay the entire Kickstarter fulfillment process. For example, we won't be able to ask for your color choices until after the project ends via a survey which means we cannot accurately prepare the rewards beforehand.
Early Bird Special (50% off)
$39    -   1 x HyperJuice 65W
$49    -   1 x HyperJuice 100W
$88    -   1 x HyperJuice 65W + 1 x HyperJuice 100W
Kickstarter Special (40% off)
$48     -   1 x HyperJuice 65W
$59     -   1 x HyperJuice 100W
$108   -   1 x HyperJuice 65W + 1 x HyperJuice 100W
Expected Retail Price
$79.99     -   1 x HyperJuice 65W
$99.99     -   1 x HyperJuice 100W
$179.98    -   1 x HyperJuice 65W + 1 x HyperJuice 100W
Reward Fulfilment
To ensure timely reward delivery, we will ship rewards via insured postal service from our fulfillment and distribution centers in:
California USA - fulfilling rewards within the United States
Project Timeline
September 28, 2020 - Kickstarter begins
October 26, 2020 - Kickstarter ends
November 2020 - Production begins
December 2020 - Shipping of Early Bird rewards
January 2021 - Shipping of Kickstarter rewards
From the team that brought you the World's First 100W USB-C battery pack and Kickstarter Most Funded power bank project
(as well as the world's 1st, smallest, and most crowdfunded 100W GaN charger)
About Us
HYPER by Sanho Corporation has been making award-winning USB-C products since 2015. We also have a long proven track record of delivering Kickstarter and Indiegogo projects. Our most successful Kickstarter and Indiegogo project, HyperDrive USB-C Hub for MacBook Pro, raised over $3.1 million and is currently the most crowdfunded MacBook and USB-C accessory. Our latest Kickstarter and Indiegogo, HyperJuice 100W GaN Charger, which raised over $3.3 million is the most crowdfunded USB-C charger. The HyperJuice 130W USB-C Battery Pack is the most crowdfunded power bank project on Kickstarter ($1.4M). Our HyperDrive USB-C Hub for iPad Pro is the most crowdfunded iPad accessory ($1.2M) and many more. So we do have a lot of experience with USB-C and Apple products. This is our 26th crowdfunding project. Our previous crowdfunding projects have altogether raised over $14 million and we have delivered to over 140,000 backers.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
Big thanks to Team MVP for producing our awesome video and product photos.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No project is without risk and challenges but we try to do our absolute best to minimize them. We felt that we have done all the necessary preliminary work prior to coming to Kickstarter. We are also no strangers to portable power, USB-C, mobile accessories or crowdfunding.

The HyperJuice charger that you see in the above video/photos are actual full working prototypes.

With your support, we can bring HyperJuice to users everywhere. We have started mass production and your contribution will help us achieve economies of scale and keep the product cost low.

We have sufficient materials to manufacture about 5,000 units now. Beyond that, the lead time is about a month. Your strong support will give us the needed affirmation to place a larger raw materials order and start mass production earlier.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi HyperJuice Backers,
This is the update you have been waiting for.
To recap what happened last month, our third-party fulfillment warehouse encountered technical errors on their end, which caused us to delay the subsequent scheduled fulfillment to prevent shipping errors. We apologize for the delay. The good news is, this has been cleared up, and we're ready for the final stretch.

Hi HyperJuice Backers,
This update will be short but has good news. As of now, all Early Bird shipments that have completed the survey should be in transit. Look to your email, as tracking numbers have been updated for those who are shipping. As for everyone else, we will begin shipping today by backer number and continue to ship as we get more inventory. For everyone that has completed their shipping survey, we estimate being complete by the end of next month.

Hi HyperJuice backers,
We appreciate your patience throughout our campaign. Starting this Friday, our 100W units will begin transit to our US distribution center. We will be using the first batch to cover Early Birds, so shipping for them will start Early to Mid April. The next set of shipments after that are currently estimated to be either end of April or the beginning of May. We are pushing to get these in your hands as soon as possible and will update you as things progress.

Thank you for all your great feedback and support! We are looking forward to shipping the rewards next month.

Earlier this month, we experienced a production delay as the outer casing tooling caused a slight surface defect on the product enclosure. We needed to rectify the defect to ensure the quality of the production. We have resumed production and the production teams are doing their best to minimize the delay. Thank you for all your great feedback and support! We are looking forward to shipping the rewards next month.

campaign.story:
Series One from The Magic Puzzle Company is a set of three new 1,000-piece jigsaw puzzles with original art and a magical surprise at the end.
We set out to create the most entertaining jigsaw puzzle you’ve ever done by combining the traditional jigsaw puzzle experience with ideas from the worlds of tabletop games and magic.
We commissioned incredible, original art from independent artists, designed from the very beginning to be used in a jigsaw puzzle
We designed a surprise ending using techniques from optical illusions and magic that adds an extra experience to the end of the puzzle
Each puzzle has over 50 easter eggs to find as you solve (and they come with a guide to help)
Each puzzle is 28" x 21", and has 1000 pieces. That's about 4% larger than the normal size of a 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle.
We imported the highest-quality puzzle cardboard in the world (1.9mm Eska "blue" stock) from the Netherlands and invented some new printing techniques so the pieces snap together and stay snapped
These puzzles have been extensively playtested to make the experience as smooth and engaging as possible from the moment you open the box to the moment you place the last piece of the last segment
When you're done with the puzzle, everything can be reset and all of the secret compartments close back up with velcro so you can share the puzzle with a friend or solve it again later.
No puzzle dust!!
Puzzle Art
Most puzzles start with stock art of some trees or cats or something. We wanted each of our puzzles to make a fantastic, tiny world. And we wanted the art to tell a story as you solve it. So we worked closely with independent artists like Sarah Becan, Boya Sun, and Felicia Chiao to create beautiful one-of-a-kind puzzle images loaded with tiny details, story quirks, and easter eggs.
"The Happy Isles" by Sarah Becan
"The Mystic Maze" by Boya Sun
"The Sunny City" by Felicia Chiao
Custom Dielines
To make the magical ending work right, we had to customize the shape of every single piece in all three puzzles. While we were at it, we also made sure that the individual puzzle-piece shapes highlighted the cool art details instead of cutting them in half.
Jigsaw puzzles start as one big piece of cardboard, and then a specially designed cutting tool called a die comes down like a stamp and slices it into a thousand pieces.
The die for the "Happy Isles" puzzle
Usually, the tolerance for that slice is about 3mm. But to pull off the magical ending in our Series One puzzles, we needed a 0.5mm tolerance. Nobody had done that before, so we had to work closely with our puzzle factory create new quality-control and die-cutting techniques to make it happen. Some of the roughly 3,000 blades that make up our dies actually had to be precise to within 0.1mm — 30 times more precise than a regular puzzle. 
An excerpt from Simon’s briefing for the puzzle factory
 One of the nice side effects of making a more precise die and using super high-quality puzzle cardboard is the pieces click together in a really satisfying way and stay together even if you need to move the puzzle.  
 Magical Surprise 
It’s always exciting to pick up a new puzzle with an image you like and then open the box and start putting together the corners and edges. But after a while, you get to the part of the puzzle where you need to assemble 400 pieces of blurry sky. And then when the puzzle's about 75% done, that feeling of “what am I doing with my time” creeps in. Eventually the last piece finally goes in and the puzzle is over. We’ve always found that part a little anticlimactic.
So we came up with a whole new way for a puzzle to end. When you place the last piece of what you thought was the end of the puzzle, you unlock a whole new part of the experience — a final act that includes both a magical illusion and a completion to the puzzle's narrative. We playtested these puzzles hundreds of times with people all over the world to figure out how to make this special ending as clear and engaging as possible, and we hope you're going to love it.
"The Happy Isles" 1000-piece puzzle
"The Mystic Maze" 1000-piece puzzle
"The Sunny City" 1000-piece puzzle
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're working with our long-time manufacturing partner Ad Magic to deliver these puzzles to you on time. We've done our best to secure freight in advance of launching this project, and our factory is still operating. But it's possible that Coronavirus will bring global logistics to a standstill. We will be transparent in our communications and keep you in the loop as we work to get these puzzles made and shipped to your house.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
Each puzzle is designed to be re-packaged and gifted or solved again when you're done. All of the secret compartments and sleeves re-seal with velcro or string ties.
Sustainable materials
Our puzzles are printed on 100% recycled, FSC-certified cardboard to minimize the environmental impact of our printing, and there is NO single-use plastic inside of the box.

support.descp: Choose between "The Happy Islands," "The Sunny City," or "The Mystic Maze."
